answers.answer: I was having problems with feeling dizzy and faint. Best thing to do is sit and put your feet up and try to drink water. I would eat more than candy like some cheese or milk or eggs. Hope you feel better.

I had this with my last pregnancy and it was due toblood sugar ad I had gestational diabetes. I'm pregnant again and its started again. It could easily be blood sugar. Takes a while for the symptoms to calm after eating something sweet. Try not to worry but do Call your doctor :) good luck.
Thanks ladies I hope I don't have gestational diabetes. I go for that test on the 11th of this month :/ I'm just trying to relax now but if it doesn't go away I'm thinking about going to the er.

Definitely sounds like low blood sugar.  I'm diabetic & injecting insulin when my blood sugar gets too low I feel shaky nervous, faint, my heart beats rapidly & I can't think it speak straight.  If you feel that way again drink milk or juice 1 cup. Wait 15 min. you should start feeling better

I had that same problem a few weeks back when I was probably around 24 weeks ended up going to the ER because I felt like I was going to pass out, turns out it was my body becoming severely dehydrated. They had to give me an iv of saline but afterwards I felt great the effect was immediate and I've been making sure I've doubled my water intake since then even though I was already drinking pretty much nothing but water and haven't had the problem since then.
If you do end up having GD don't panic.. my baby was fine and ended up being only 6lb6 despite them telling me she'd be huge! she's now 11 months- happy, healthy, advanced, clever and beautiful.

question: So I'm 26 +5 weeks pregnant and tonight out of nowhere I have begun to feel very shaky faint and dizzy.I have tried eating a piece of candy to see if it was my blood sugar but still no help.I've tried relaxing but I'm too shaky to sit still and I'm a little worried.does anyone have a reccomendation or have had this before? ?
title: dizzy and faint
